summary.title: Infosecotb.com with vMeNext Threat Model
summary.description:
Infosecotb.com is a professional cybersecurity blog hosted on WordPress through BlueHost. The blog serves as a platform for sharing insights, articles, and resources related to information security, targeting cybersecurity professionals and enthusiasts.

Website Structure:
•	Content Management System (CMS): Built on WordPress, allowing for easy content creation, management, and publishing.
•	User Interaction: Features such as chatbot, comments, contact forms, and newsletter subscriptions that facilitate user engagement.
•	Categorized Content: Articles are organized into categories based on topics 

Functionality:
•	Article Publishing: Regularly updated with new blog posts that include technical guides, best practices, and industry insights.
•	Search Functionality: Allows users to search for specific topics or articles.
•	Social Media Integration: Links to social media platforms for sharing and promoting content.
•	vMeNext AI powered chatbot

User Types:
•	Visitors: General users seeking information on cybersecurity topics.
•	Administrators: Individuals with backend access for managing content, settings, and website security.

Technical Environment:
•	Hosting: Utilizes BlueHost for hosting, which provides shared or dedicated server resources.
•	Plugins and Themes: Employs various WordPress plugins for enhanced functionality (e.g., SEO, analytics, security).
•	Database: Relies on a MySQL database for storing content, user information, and site settings.
•	vMeNext chatbot published using iFrames

vMeNext is a comprehensive AI-powered chatbot system designed to serve as an intelligent interface for blog content and website management. Built with modern Python technologies, it combines the power of OpenAI's GPT models with automated web scraping, monitoring, and user engagement features.

Key Capabilities:
•	Intelligent Conversations: Powered by OpenAI's latest GPT models for natural, context-aware responses
•	Blog Content Integration: Automatic scraping, processing, and summarization of blog posts
•	Website Monitoring: Continuous availability checking with real-time alerts
•	Document Processing: Support for multiple file formats (PDF, DOCX, TXT, MD)
•	User Engagement: Automated email notifications and contact management
•	Analytics Dashboard: Website uptime statistics with visualizations

data.name: Visitor
data.description: Visitor connecting to infosecotb.com using a browser

data.name:
vMeNext
App
data.description: Gradio ChatBot Python Application with RAG Running on Hugging Face Space

threats.title: Tampering with vMeNext App Input
threats.description: The vMeNext App process in Hugging Face Trust Zone receives inputs via iFrame from infosecotb.com in BlueHost zone, crossing trust boundaries without encryption.
threats.mitigation: Validate and sanitize all inputs using content security policies.

threats.title: Denial of Service on vMeNext App
threats.description: The vMeNext App could be targeted for DoS via excessive API requests over public networks from external actors.
threats.mitigation: Implement rate limiting and DDoS protection mechanisms.

threats.title: Elevation of Privilege in vMeNext App
threats.description: Unauthorized elevation could occur if privileges are not checked in this web application process adjacent to external APIs.
threats.mitigation: Enforce strict RBAC and privilege separation.

data.name: about_me folder
data.description: Folder with documents read by Python application and provided to AI ChatBot as a prompt context.

threats.title: Tampering with about_me Folder
threats.description: The about_me folder store in Hugging Face Trust Zone could be tampered via RAG requests from vMeNext App.
threats.mitigation: Implement file integrity monitoring and access controls.

threats.title: Information Disclosure from Folder
threats.description: Unencrypted store may disclose information if accessed across boundaries.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt stored documents and restrict access.

threats.title: Spoofing of Developer Identity
threats.description: The DEV actor, located in the Dev/Admin Trust Zone, could be spoofed by an attacker to gain unauthorized access to development tools and deploy malicious code.
threats.mitigation: Implement multi-factor authentication and role-based access control for developer accounts.

data.name:
Cursor
IDE
data.description: Cursor IDE used for developing and running vMe Next Dev application and deploying on Hugging Face Space

threats.title: Tampering with Cursor IDE
threats.description: The Cursor IDE process in Dev/Admin Trust Zone could be tampered with during development, affecting deployments to Hugging Face zone.
threats.mitigation: Use code signing and integrity checks for IDE tools.

data.name:
infosecotb
.com
data.description: InfoSec Outside The Box Cybersecurity Blog created and managed with WordPress CMS with vMeNext AI powered chatbot added using iFrame

threats.title: Information Disclosure in infosecotb.com
threats.description: The infosecotb.com process in BlueHost Trust Zone handles web requests from external Visitor actor over unencrypted channels.
threats.mitigation: Enforce HTTPS for all communications and encrypt sensitive data at rest.

threats.title: Elevation of Privilege in infosecotb.com
threats.description: Potential for EoP if admin flows from external zones ingress without proper auth.
threats.mitigation: Implement robust authentication and authorization controls.

threats.title: Information Disclosure on iFrame Flow
threats.description: The iFrame https flow crosses from Hugging Face to BlueHost zones without encryption, over potentially public networks.
threats.mitigation: Enforce encryption on the flow and use secure iFrame attributes.

threats.title: Tampering with iFrame Data
threats.description: Data in transit could be tampered as the flow traverses trust boundaries.
threats.mitigation: Implement integrity checks like HMAC on transmitted data.

threats.title: Denial of Service on RAG Request
threats.description: The RAG Request flow within Hugging Face zone could be flooded, denying service to the store.
threats.mitigation: Apply rate limiting on internal requests.

threats.title: Information Disclosure on RAG Response
threats.description: RAG Response flow inside Hugging Face zone but unencrypted, risking disclosure if zone is compromised.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt internal data flows.

threats.title: Tampering with SMTP Relay
threats.description: The smtp relay flow over public network from SMTP2GO to Admin could be tampered despite encryption.
threats.mitigation: Use signed emails and verify sender integrity.

threats.title: Information Disclosure on API Response
threats.description: API Response flow from SMTP2GO to vMeNext App over public encrypted network, but potential for disclosure if keys compromised.
threats.mitigation: Rotate API keys regularly and monitor for anomalies.

threats.title: Tampering with API Request
threats.description: API Request flow from vMeNext App to SMTP2GO over public network.
threats.mitigation: Use cryptographic signatures for requests.

threats.title: Elevation of Privilege via Admin Response
threats.description: Admin Response flow from vMe Next Dev to SMTP2GO could allow privilege escalation if not authorized properly.
threats.mitigation: Validate all admin responses with auth tokens.

threats.title: Information Disclosure on Admin Response
threats.description: Admin Response flow over public network from SMTP2GO to vMe Next Dev.
threats.mitigation: Ensure end-to-end encryption and secure channels.

threats.title: Tampering with API Request to OpenAI
threats.description: API Request flow from vMe Next Dev to OpenAI over public network.
threats.mitigation: Implement request signing and validation.

threats.title: Information Disclosure on API Request
threats.description: API Request flow from vMeNext App to OpenAI over public encrypted network, risking prompt leakage.
threats.mitigation: Minimize sensitive data in requests and use secure APIs.

threats.title: Tampering with API Response from OpenAI
threats.description: API Response flow from OpenAI to vMeNext App over public network.
threats.mitigation: Verify response integrity with hashes.

data.name: Response
data.description: Response from infosecotb.com website including vMeNext chatbot

threats.title: Denial of Service on Response Flow
threats.description: Response flow from Visitor to infosecotb.com over public network could be disrupted.
threats.mitigation: Implement redundancy and traffic monitoring.

data.name: Request
data.description: Request to infosecotb.com website including vMeNext chatbot

threats.title: Tampering with Request Flow
threats.description: Request flow from infosecotb.com to Visitor over unencrypted public network.
threats.mitigation: Enforce HTTPS and input validation.

threats.title: Information Disclosure on Admin Response
threats.description: Admin Response flow from Browser to WordPress over public network.
threats.mitigation: Use encrypted sessions and secure cookies.

threats.title: Tampering with Admin Request
threats.description: Admin Request flow from WordPress to Browser crossing zones.
threats.mitigation: Implement CSRF protection and request validation.

threats.title: Spoofing on Admin Request
threats.description: Admin Request flow from Browser to BlueHost over public network.
threats.mitigation: Use mutual TLS for admin connections.

threats.title: Repudiation of Admin Actions
threats.description: Admin Response flow from BlueHost to Browser may lack logging.
threats.mitigation: Enable detailed audit logging for all admin activities.

threats.title: Elevation of Privilege via Admin Response
threats.description: Admin Response flow from Hugging Face Host Admin to Browser.
threats.mitigation: Strictly enforce authorization checks on responses.

threats.title: Tampering with Admin Request
threats.description: Admin Request flow from Browser to Hugging Face Host Admin over public network.
threats.mitigation: Use integrity protection mechanisms.

threats.title: Information Disclosure on Deployment Request
threats.description: Deployment Request flow from Cursor IDE to Hugging Face API over public network.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt deployment payloads.

threats.title: Tampering with Deployment Response
threats.description: Deployment Response flow from Hugging Face API to Cursor IDE.
threats.mitigation: Validate deployment artifacts with signatures.

threats.title: Denial of Service on API Response
threats.description: API Response flow from OpenAI to vMe Next Dev over public network.
threats.mitigation: Implement timeouts and retry logic.

data.name:
MySQL
DB
data.description: MySQL Database used for WordPress website

threats.title: Spoofing of Admin Identity
threats.description: The Admin actor in the Dev/Admin Trust Zone may be spoofed, allowing unauthorized administrative actions across trust boundaries to BlueHost and Hugging Face zones.
threats.mitigation: Enforce strong authentication mechanisms including MFA and regular credential rotation.

threats.title: Repudiation in vMe Next Dev
threats.description: Actions in vMe Next Dev process in Dev/Admin zone may not be logged, allowing repudiation of deployments.
threats.mitigation: Implement comprehensive logging and non-repudiable audit trails.

threats.title: Spoofing via Browser
threats.description: The Browser process in Dev/Admin zone could be spoofed to perform unauthorized admin requests to multiple zones.
threats.mitigation: Use browser security features and client-side certificate auth.

data.name:
OpenAI
API
data.description: Artificial Intelligence API secured with a key

threats.title: Spoofing of OpenAI API
threats.description: The OpenAI API actor, positioned outside trust zones, could be spoofed if API calls from vMeNext App cross public networks without proper verification.
threats.mitigation: Use API keys with IP whitelisting and validate server certificates.

data.name:
SMTP2GO
API
data.description: E-mail relay hosted system API secured with key

threats.title: Spoofing of SMTP2GO API
threats.description: The SMTP2GO API actor outside trust zones may be spoofed in communications over public networks from vMeNext App.
threats.mitigation: Implement API authentication with secrets and TLS certificate pinning.

data.name:
Hugging Face
Host Admin
data.description: Hugging Face Hosting Administrator Control Panel

threats.title: Elevation of Privilege in Hugging Face Admin
threats.description: The Hugging Face Host Admin actor could allow elevation of privilege if admin flows cross from Dev/Admin zone to Hugging Face zone without proper authorization.
threats.mitigation: Apply least privilege principles and audit admin access logs.

threats.title: Spoofing of Hugging Face API
threats.description: The Hugging Face API actor may be spoofed in deployment requests from Cursor IDE in Dev/Admin zone.
threats.mitigation: Use secure API tokens and verify endpoint authenticity.

threats.title: Spoofing of BlueHost Actor
threats.description: The BlueHost actor inside BlueHost Trust Zone could be spoofed to manipulate hosting configurations.
threats.mitigation: Require certificate-based authentication for hosting admin access.

threats.title: Tampering with WordPress
threats.description: The WordPress process in BlueHost Trust Zone could be tampered via publishing flows from admin.
threats.mitigation: Regularly update WordPress and plugins, use security plugins.

threats.title: Information Disclosure in WordPress
threats.description: Sensitive data could leak via MySQL interactions within the zone.
threats.mitigation: Encrypt database connections and sensitive fields.
